glyrepr 0.1.0.9016

Decide the Type of Monosaacharides in a Glycan Graph

decide_glycan_mono_type.Rd

This function trys to decide the type of monosaccharides in a glycan graph.

Usage

decide_glycan_mono_type(glycan)

Arguments

glycan

A glycan graph.

Value

A character string specifying the monosaccharide type.

Details

By saying "trys" in the description, it means that the function only checks the first monosaccharide in the graph to decide the type. This is reasonable because the monosaccharides in a glycan graph are always of the same type if it was created with the functions in this package. The validation functions will ensure this.

Three types of monosaccharides

There are three types of monosaccharides:

  • concrete: e.g. "Gal", "GlcNAc", "Glc", "Fuc", etc.

  • generic: e.g. "Hex", "HexNAc", "HexA", "HexN", etc.

  • simple: e.g. "H", "N", "S", "F".

For the full list of monosaccharides, use available_monosaccharides().

See also

convert_glycan_mono_type(), convert_mono_type(), decide_mono_type()

Examples

decide_glycan_mono_type(n_glycan_core(mono_type = "concrete"))
#> [1] "concrete"
decide_glycan_mono_type(n_glycan_core(mono_type = "generic"))
#> [1] "generic"
decide_glycan_mono_type(n_glycan_core(mono_type = "simple"))
#> [1] "simple"
